answerText: Walden Inversion (also accept Inversion of Stereochemistry)[10] Walden inversions convert compounds with this property from optically inactive to optically active. Compounds with this property are optically inactive because they're superimposable upon their mirror image.
heading: Missiles of October |2011 | 3 | 7 | Science | Chemistry | College
subject: Science
question: Question: For ten points each, name some important mechanisms that encountered in organic chemistry: [10] This inversion occurs whenever an SN2 reaction takes place on a chiral center. It can be visualized by imagining an umbrella turned inside out in a storm.
